translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Book of Conditional Relations in Reverse Order

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Tikatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (5)🔽23.44. Sanidassanattika, Vitakkattika🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nasavitakkasavicāraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho savitakkasavicāro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sani dassana ttika vitakka ttika  na sa nidassana sa ppaṭigham na sa vitakka sa vicāram dhammam paṭicca anidassana appaṭighaḥ sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With-object-support, with-investigation🔽With-object-support and impinging, with-investigation and with-reflection, a state … arises … with-object-support and impinging, without-investigation and without-reflection, as root-cause condition. (In brief.) As root-cause condition, three lines; … as non-hindrance condition, three lines.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ naavitakkavicāramattaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho avitakkavicāramatto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ naavitakkaavicāraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho🔽avitakkaavicāro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekavīsa, ārammaṇe
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na a vitakka vicāra mattam dhammam paṭicca anidassana appaṭighaḥ avitakka vicāra mattaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na a vitakka avicāram dhammam paṭicca sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ  avitakka avicāraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekavīsa ārammaṇe
translated: With-object-support and impinging, without-investigation and with-reflection only, a state … arises … with-object-support and impinging, without-investigation and without-reflection, as root-cause condition. (In brief.) As root-cause condition, three lines; … as non-hindrance condition, three lines.

With-object-support and impinging, without-investigation and without-reflection, a state … arises … with-object-support and impinging, without-investigation and with-reflection only, as root-cause condition. (In brief.) As root-cause condition, twenty-one lines; as object condition, three lines; … as non-hindrance condition, twenty-one lines.
